According to the latest data from the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention), from 2017 and 2018 surveys), 1 in 5 youth in the United States is obese. Not just carrying "baby fat", but significantly overweight.

The number of obese youths is up 25% since 2005-2005.

"The news is disappointing, given that programs across the country have for years been trying to reduce childhood obesity," one expert told the Associated Press.

UCLA obesity researcher Dr. Tannaz Moin warned that childhood obesity is especially worrisome because it can put kids on track for problems like diabetes and heart disease.

The current coronavirus crisis — with school closings and stay-at-home orders — adds to the problem, Moin told the AP.

“Kids for the most part are at home, and not at school with recess, and getting even less (physical) activity,” she said. https://apnews.com/45b59ad0c4c3996de75ab407ebec4c26

NHCSB Families. School Nurse Rena Gilliam, BSN, RN
reminds us that it's still cold and flu season!

While she loves to see kids in school, happy, healthy, and ready to learn, she also notes five times when your child should NOT be here at New Heights. If s/he has:

1. A fever of 100° or greater in the past 24 hours
2. A sore throat and/or swollen neck glands
3. Vomiting or diarrhea in the past 24 hours
4. An undiagnosed rash or skin eruption
5. Any eye infection which has not yet been medically treated for at least 24 hours.

Please contact Nurse Gilliam with any questions.

Thanksgiving is Thursday and whether your family has a big celebration, a small celebration, or no celebration at all, it could still be an opportunity to say 'thank you' to something that matters to you and your children. Might be for family members, for someone who healed this year, could be for someone who passed who gave you so much.

It could also be for the perfect (and not so perfect) tomatoes that grew in your plot this summer, a book or movie that made you think differently.

Little things and big things.

You might enjoy this fun article from the Greater Good Science Center called 6 Habits of Highly Grateful People. One of the habits is liking pancakes (sort of)!

One thing is true: all of us at New Heights are grateful for you! https://greatergood.berkeley.edu/article/item/six_habits_of_highly_grateful_people

Dear New Heights Parents, Families, Staff, and Community,

I just wanted to take a moment to thank all of the staff, students, and families that made last night's Multi-Cultural event happen. I have been an educator in some form or fashion for the past 19 years. While I have moments that I can classify as special that have taken place with such an individual group, never have I eaten, danced, and laughed with staff, students, and families at the same time as much as I have at our two Multi-Cultural Events. It had the feel of a large family gathering, and I just wanted to take a moment to thank all of you for making this place special!

Thank you!
~Omari Walker
